Name: Escape from New York
Comment: Very enjoyable (and often funny) dystopian action/escape film. Kurt Russell stomping around in an eyepatch. Him and John Carptenter doing what they do best

Name: Blue Jean
Comment: Rosy McEwen is GREAT as a closeted PE teacher in Thatcher's Britain. Featuring a very solid geordie accent from McEwen. A fantastic feature length debut from Georgia Oakley. One of the best queer Happy Hundies that we've seen

Name: Eighth Grade
Comment: A funny, sad coming-of-age film that will probably not make you miss being a pre-teen but will make you enjoy
A nervy, tense film set in Belfast against the backdrop of the Troubles

Name: The Evil Dead
Comment: A classic low-budget "video nasty" horror. High levels of gore that got it banned in some countries. Also director Sam Raimi's breakthrough film. He later directed Spider Man but this is not like Spider Man

Name: Drive
Comment: Visually great, neo-noir(?) tough nasty but beautiful film. Great performances from Carey Mulligan, Ryan Goslin and Gosling's fancy jacket

Name: Prey
Comment: Have heard divided opinion on this BUT I like it. A Predator film set in the Northern Great Plains in 1719

Name: Office Space
Comment: An absolute classic film about the mundanity of shit jobs

Name: This Is Spinal Tap
Comment: A rocku-mocku-mentary. Turn it up to 11

Name: Mid90s
Comment: A cool coming of age story with some great young actors and some gnarly skateboard tricks

Name: Halloween
Comment: John Carpenter is maybe the patron saint of Happy Hundies. The man knows how to make a tight, gripping film that will keep you entertained. It's a classic horror film and Jamie Lee Curtis makes her breakout debut role!

Name: Blue Ruin
Comment: I can't remember much about this film but I know I enjoyed it. I think it was about revenge

Name: Bodies Bodies Bodies
Comment: Traverses the tropes of a classic lock-in slasher whodunnit by offering a funny satire of Gen Z and the internet and society etc

Name: Welcome to the Dollhouse
Comment: A coming-of-age comedy that will not make you yearn for your days of youth

Name: Funny Pages
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: The Witch
Comment: This is an absolute banger. Dark, folk horror-y. Features stellar performances from a cast including Anya Taylor-Joy and the gravel-voiced Ralph Ineson aka Chris Finch from the Office (UK!)

Name: Shiva Baby
Comment: Funny & uncomfortable. Rachel Sennott is great in this

Name: I, Daniel Blake
Comment: A sad film with a powerful critique of cruel government policy. One watch is enough for me but you have to watch it!

Name: Green Room
Comment: A horror film featuring rock music and neo-Nazis, what's not to like? (Apart from neo-Nazis!!)

Name: Kimi
Comment: We are Zoe Kravtiz fans here at Happy Hundies. A thriller about how tech can be bad? Sounds implausible but we'll go with it

Name: Space Jam
Comment:
Everybody get up it's time to slam now
We got a real jam goin' down
Welcome to the Space Jam. One for the nostalgia heads and young heads. Watched this again at a cinema recently and had a great time

Name: Evil Dead Rise
Comment: In our opinion, a well-made contribution to the classic Evil Dead franchise. Can be enjoyed on its own or, even better, after watching the originals

Name: The Wicker Man
Comment: Wowza, folk horror at its absolute best. This is the originator for a reason

Name: Dead Man's Shoes
Comment: Dark gritty revenge flick set in Derbyshire. Featuring compelling improvised dialogue. Also quite sad. This film did not make me happy but it is a Happy Hundy

Name: The Quiet Girl
Comment: Excellent, excellent Irish-language film. Slow, quiet and lingering but never boring. Catherine Clinch is great and, despite being so young, conveys so much emotion

Name: Easy Rider
Comment: A hazy drug-addled counter-cultural road movie on motorbikes with a great soundtrack and a top-notch cast of Hollywood heavy hitters

Name: Wayne's World
Comment: Waynes World, party time, excellent

Name: Napoleon Dynamite
Comment: A fun deadpan indy

Name: All My Friends Hate Me
Comment: Anxiety-inducing film that makes you feel on edge, but I like that. It's almost a horror but is really a dark comedy playing on that feeling of being out of place even among your friends. Or is that just me? I digress!

Name: The Father
Comment: A sad, engaging, mind-bending watch about a man's deteriorating health. Olivia Coleman and Anthony Hopkins play off each other so well

Name: Assault on Precinct 13
Comment: What's that? Another John Carpenter Happy Hundy? You bet. This time a bottle film set inside a police station under attack

Name: My Neighbor Totoro
Comment: A fantasy animation for kids and adults alike from Studio Ghibli

Name: Airplane!
Comment: Surreal silly (in a good way) comedy parodying plane disaster films

Name: Zombieland
Comment: A zombie horror comedy featuring a great cast and some gory fun

Name: Sexy Beast
Comment: A fantastic opening scene gives way to a top notch crime thriller under the baking sun of the Costa del Sol. Ray Winstone and Ben Kingsley are at their best here. Proper good English film innit

Name: Stand by Me
Comment: Nostalgic film harkening back to our days of youth when we would go looking for dead bodies

Name: La haine
Comment: An often-hyped French film that more than lives up to it. A gritty tale about people living in the forgotten and deprived outskirts of Paris

Name: Trainspotting
Comment: Consistently ranked as one of the best British films of all time and for good reason. A funny and sad film about addiction and poverty and friendship!

Name: Taken
Comment: It could have been a throwaway action film but it's saved by Liam Neeson and some well-orchestrated violence. Although the Albanian Tourist Board must not be happy. We don't blame them

Name: Monsters, Inc.
Comment: Surely one of the best Pixar animations. Touching and funny!

Name: Mean Girls
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Son of Rambow
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Ice Age
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Lady Bird
Comment: Beautiful film with a great story. Top work all round from director Greta Gerwig and Saoirse Ronan in the lead role

Name: Klaus
Comment: A modern Christmas film that isn't shit. Praise be

Name: Juno
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Punch-Drunk Love
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Attack the Block
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Liar Liar
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Ace Ventura: Pet Detective
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Cloverfield
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Lilo & Stitch
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Happy Gilmore
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: A History of Violence
Comment: A film about a man with A History of Violence. And that man is played by Viggo Mortensen. Get it on, ffs

Name: Source Code
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Kung Fu Panda
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: The Naked Gun: From the Files of Police Squad!
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Thank You for Smoking
Comment: The relationship between a tobacco lobbyist (boo!) and his daughter

Name: 127 Hours
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: First Blood
Comment: NB this is a Rambo film despite not being called Rambo: First Blood. Violent and potentially politically-questionable but a good time!

Name: Rushmore
Comment: Quirky but not too quirky that it becomes annoying. Like possibly some of Wes Anderson's other films. No offence to the Andersonistas out there

Name: Blazing Saddles
Comment: A provocative comedy that parodies the Western genre and takes aim at racism in America. The jokes in this walk a fine line between satire and genuine offense, so consider yourself warned

Name: The Hangover
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Moonrise Kingdom
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Shrek
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: The Breakfast Club
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: The Iron Giant
Comment: This film shows that Vin Diesel is multi-faceted, although I guess this film is also about family, which he does love to talk about

Name: How to Train Your Dragon
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Finding Nemo
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Up
Comment: I'm not crying, you are

Name: Inside Out
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Toy Story
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Toy Story 2
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: WALL·E
Comment: Happy Hundies consultant: "Heart warming film, what an interesting comment on civilisation"

Name: Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Life of Brian
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Reservoir Dogs
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: You Were Never Really Here
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: The Platform
Comment: A violent, claustrophobic Spanish dystopian horror that says something about society, ya know?

Name: Identity
Comment: A surprising psychological lock-in thriller set in a motel. For the John Cusack fans out there, this film has lots of shots of John Cusack brooding, being grumpy or looking exasperated. The dream

Name: Glengarry Glen Ross
Comment: "A man is his job". A film about capitalism and masculinity told through four smarmy property salesmen competing against each other. This cracker just creeps in at 100 minutes and has fantastic dialogue. It feels like a play, probably because originally it was!

Name: Wag The Dog
Comment: Political comedy about the lengths that these bloody politicians(!) will go to to manipulate the masses

Name: Moon
Genre: Psychological Drama, Space Sci-Fi, Drama, Mystery, Sci-Fi
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Batman: Mask of the Phantasm
Comment: 90s Batman animation with all the associated dark visuals and themes

Name: Dogtooth
Comment: Unnerving, creepy Greek film about an abusive father, his wife and their children. Great acting performances, but definitely not a chill watch

Name: Mike Bassett: England Manager
Comment: England are playing four-four-fucking-two. An English sports comedy about a hapless manager put in charge of the men's national team. Some good laughs with a great performance from Ricky Tomlinson. This is unlikely to appeal to everyone but a must-watch for fans of sport/comedy/sport comedy

Name: The Limey
Genre: Dark Comedy, Crime, Drama, Mystery, Thriller
Comment: A revenge flick about an Englishman in LA with some novel editing, making regular use of montages. Story is like Taken meets Sexy Beast (both coincidentially Happy Hundies ;) ). If you can look past Terence Stamp having to explain cockney rhyming slang to Americans seemingly every 5 minutes then this is a good watch

Name: Human Traffic
Comment: "This could turn Hare Krishna into a badboy". A fun, cool British film about coming of age and music and clubbing and love and stuff like that

Name: One Hour Photo
Comment: Robin Williams shows off his dramatic acting chops in this tense thriller based around a photo printing shop. Comment from Happy Hundies Internal Steering Committee Affiliate/Housemate "strange film, strange ending… in a good way. Mrs Doubtfire meets You. Dark and uncomfortable watch"

Name: Frances Ha
Genre: Coming-of-Age, Quirky Comedy, Comedy, Drama, Romance
Comment: Funny, awkward film about a dancer called Frances played by Greta Gerwig navigating life in her late 20s in New York. Some good satire about privileged pseudo-intellectuals in the Big City

Name: Fantastic Planet
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Predestination
Genre: Time Travel, Action, Drama, Sci-Fi, Thriller
Comment: An entertaining, slightly silly time travel tale featuring Ethan Hawke being as gruff as ever and Sarah Snook being versatile as hell - I'll tell you that much for free. Housemate judgement: "you can't make a time travel film without making it a bit silly"

Name: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre
Genre: Psychological Horror, Slasher Horror, Splatter Horror, Teen Horror, Horror
Comment: A brutal cult horror that just feels really raw and grim. Few horror films have made me feel this uncomfortable and somehow that's a good thing!

Name: A Nightmare on Elm Street
Genre: Slasher Horror, Supernatural Horror, Teen Horror, Horror
Comment: One of our favourite classic horror films. Even if Freddie Krueger isn't even that good at the whole killing thing and did give us the ick.

Name: A Cabin in the Woods
Genre: Monster Horror, Psychological Horror, Supernatural Horror, Horror, Mystery, Thriller
Comment: This film asks a lot of questions of the audience, like: is this film good? Is it bad? What's up with Chris Hemsworth? Ultimately we don't care. This horror/comedy/horror comedy parody horror comedy is not for everyone but it is for us

Name: Bottoms
Comment: A fun Queer parody of high school movies

Name: Das Fest des Huhnes
Comment: A hidden gem mockumentary that flips the script, with a Sub-Saharan African film crew conducting an ethnographic documentary into the seemingly alien culture of Austria and its people

Name: Farha
Comment: A moving painful story about a Palestinian girl watching the horrific events of the 1948 Nakba unfold around her village

Name: Shallow Grave
Comment: Well-balanced Scottish thriller/black comedy. Featuring surreal elements that director Danny Boyle would later employ in the classic film Trainspotting

Name: Sick of Myself
Genre: Dark Comedy, Psychological Drama, Drama, Horror
Comment: You can't get enough of films satirising misanthropic, middle-class characters and their lives, can you? This time set in Oslo - a dark comedy with an excellent performance from Kristine Kujath Thorp

Name: One Cut of the Dead
Comment: Japanese cult zombie comedy that will leave you very surprised

Name: Suspiria
Comment: A beautiful vivid colourful horror set in one of the scariest places imaginable: Germany

Name: Creep
Comment: A flawed but genuinely disturbing found-footage horror with a great performance from comedic actor Mark Duplass

Name: Army of Darkness
Genre: Farce, Quest, Supernatural Horror, Comedy, Horror
Comment: Funny violent cult classic that can be enjoyed either as a standalone or after watching the Evil Dead precursors

Name: Babylon
Comment: Fantastic film about the struggles and joys of British Jamaican life in London in the 70s. Political, powerful and a great soundtrack

Name: Wet Hot American Summer
Comment: Silly and very funny parody of American summer camp films. It walks a fine line between genius and stupidity so suspend your scepticism for 97 minutes and enjoy

Name: Waiting for Guffman
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Full Time
Comment: A tense nail-biting drama that creates a similar feeling to Uncut Gems, but transported to a more serious story of a single mother trying to make ends meet

Name: The Innocent
Comment: Review from a Happy Hundies consultant: "It was perfectly balanced between silly and serious. Comical and sweet but dark and tragic too. I liked it! Not the best film of my life but super entertaining"

Name: The Settlers
Comment: A brutally violent but beautiful film about the colonialism and genocide in Chile in the early 20th century

Name: Wicked Little Letters
Comment: A solid comedy with a fun premise. It's probably not going to change your life but great for a bit of mid-week fun

Name: Another Country
Comment: Funny, moving true-ish story of two friends navigating sexuality, class and politics within the confines of the 1930s rigid British boarding school system. Based on the life of future diplomat and Soviet double agent Guy Burgess. Features a couple of gorgeous, gorgeous early-career young lads called Colin Firth and Rupert Everett

Name: The Full Monty
Comment: A genuinely hilarious, touching film set in the North of England. A story about a group of unemployed, working class men in the 1990s finding a unique way to earn a living. Oh and a great soundtrack to boot!

Name: Mad Max 2: The Road Warrior
Comment: Review from a Happy Hundies consultant: "Max isn't as mad as Mel but he still has what it takes to face 'The Humungus' in this one"

Name: The Warriors
Comment: Fun, stylish, a bit silly. A street gang battles to get home after every other street gang turns on them (everyone in this film seems to be in a street gang). Come for the punchups and slightly cheesy dialogue, stay for the bonkers costumes

Name: Susi
Comment: Over the top, low(ish) budget, violent. A bit of Rambo, a bit of a Inglorious Basterds, a bit of Clint Eastwood - a spaghetti Western set in Finland during WW2. Watch this if you like action films with a bit of farce

Name: But I'm a Cheerleader
Comment: Campy, funny, queer, warm-hearted. What's not to love? A comedy about a cheerleader sent to conversion therapy with a great performance by Natasha Lyonne (Orange is the New Black) and a fun appearance from RuPaul of Drag Race fame

Name: Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Chicken Run
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Wallace & Gromit: A Close Shave
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Wallace & Gromit: The Wrong Trousers
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Wallace & Gromit: A Grand Day Out
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: Shaun of the Dead
Comment: A classic of the horror-comedy genre

Name: Easy A
Comment: Emma Stone makes this, of course

Name: Beetlejuice
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: A Fistful of Dollars
Comment: Comment coming soon!

Name: After Hours
Comment: Just about a "comedy" but also a tense, strange thriller about an evening that goes very wrong. A Martin Scorcese film but not what you expect from a Scorcese film

Name: Blood Simple
Comment: The debut film from the Coen Brothers (Fargo, Big Lewbowski, O Brother Where Art Thou?, No Country for Old Men) so expect murder and deceit and a few laughs. Not quite as funny as Fargo and Big Lebowski but well worth a watch

Name: Alan Partridge: Alpha Papa
Comment: A great film tie-in from one of British TV's greatest comedy characters. You'll likely have a good time even if you haven't watched Partridge before

Name: Duel
Comment: A menacing, road rage thriller from Steven Spielberg, back when your ETs, your Jaws(s), your Raiders of the Lost Arks of this world were just a twinkle in his eye

Name: Little Shop of Horrors
Comment: Review from a Happy Hundies musical theatre consultant: "I like how self-aware it is. Very silly. Silly vibes. Do you know Steve Martin? He’s in it. In his prime. Cracking songs"

Name: Return of the Living Dead
Comment: Excellent zombie film, which helped establish many now-cliches of the genre. Horror fans, don't be put off by the "Comedy" tag, it's more a horror film which doesn't take itself too seriously than a true "Horror Comedy".

Name: Chopper
Comment: Eric Bana made a name for himself on the world stage with this violent, occasionally funny almost-true story of Australian celebrity prisoner Mark 'Chopper' Read
